results.title: Study Method
results.brief_description: This “How to Study” guide explores in detail problems students have in studying. Study techniques and their application are examined from both the Educational and Psychological aspects. Includes: effective reading, note taking and study organisation, setting targets and handling anxiety and stress (includes demonstration of relaxation techniques).

results.title: Students in Berlin
results.brief_description: Shows the Free University of West Berlin and students from all over the world in part-time jobs in the city and at their studies. The history of the Free University, from its establishment by the students themselves to its present prosperous condition, with many fine buildings, numerous research institutes and large self-governing student body.

results.title: Struggle for China: the story of the Chinese revolution (D)
results.brief_description: Using a wide variety of material drawn from Archives including propaganda material filmed by American, Chinese Communist, Nationalist and Japanese cameramen, this film reconstructs events in China from 1900-1949, one of the bloodiest and most turbulent periods in history. Narrated by James Mason. WARNING: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB

results.title: Stronger since the war?
results.creator_credit: Brett Porter, Gil Brealey, Australian Broadcasting Commission and Intertel
results.brief_description: Examines the status of women in Japan since the end of World War II, and their new social and economic conditions. Raises the question of whether the Japanese women are better off since their emancipation from the traditional way of life. Shows the changed life of women of the fishing villages and rice farms, and of women in the city; geishas, a Zen-Buddhist ‘Garden of Nothingness’, and the famous Japanese Tea Ceremony are also recorded. Awards: Winner of Silver Award, Documentary Category, Australian Film Awards, 1965)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brett Porter, Gil Brealey, Australian Broadcasting Commission and Intertel

results.title: String sounds
results.creator_credit: Pieter Van Deusen and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the range of string sounds available, using different kinds of instruments, strings and ways of making strings vibrate. Demonstrates basic principles of string instruments and presents various performances. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: String quartet
results.creator_credit: Robert Parker, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Carl Pini String Quartet is seen and heard against a variety of scenic backgrounds performing the Debussy Quartet in G Minor. Also includes scenes of the Quartet at rehearsal and recording and interviews with members.
